did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Exhibit items, records and related material for an exhibition researched and designed by Jennning's undergraduate and graduate students (2003-2006).

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor in the Dept. of Design and Environmental Analysis, Cornell University.
Jennings received a B.S. in Housing and Interior Design (1968) and a M.S. in Housing and Urban Studies (1969) both from Oklahoma State University.
Jenning's research interests focus on oridnary American buildings and interiors, as well as contemporary interior design history, theory, and criticism.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Exhibit items, records and related material for an exhibition researched and designed by Jennning's undergraduate and graduate students (2003-2006).

Includes slides used for teaching; prints and negatives used in her book Cheap and Tasteful Dwellings; photos and slides of student winners of various competitions (1993-2005); information about Interior Archetypes Research and Teaching Project , initiated in 1997.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Human Ecology. Design and Environmental Analysis.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Jan Jennings papers, #23-16-3913. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Records and related items for an exhibition researched and designed by Jan Jenning's undergraduate and graduate students
Slides used for research and teaching - American Vernacular Architecture and Interiors
Slides and photos of student competitions; Sketchbook and student project by Elizabeth O'Brien
Material on Interior Archetypes Research and Teaching Project
Prints and negatives of images used in Jan's book, Cheap and Tasteful Dwellings
